data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Relatively speaking, you can take your steps backward, but not forward. If you always face forward, you always take first steps. In any way, they are all same. So, the answer is Yes.

The initial position is facing forward. Steps 6 - 6 + 8 = 10 steps. 8 + 1 = 8. 6 + 1 = 13. 6 - 1 = 5. 8 + 2 = 10. 5 - 2 = 3. The starting point is facing forward. So, the answer is No.

Right turns into left is only part of the answer. The whole point of alternating 2 sets of instructions is that you face forward for each run of instructions. If you take this direction each time, you'll always return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.
